displaytitle: Soyez Amoureuses, Vous Serez Heureuses (Love and You will be Happy), from the Suite of Late Woodblock Prints (also known as the Vollard Suite)
medium: Woodblock print in black, brown, and gray inks on two sheets of thin Japanese wove paper
creditline: Museum purchase, Fowler McCormick, Class of 1921, Fund
inscribed: Inscribed in pen and black ink, lower left corner: no. 1
catalograisonne: Guérin 581; Kornfeld 55 I and II/II, b2

titles.title: Soyez Amoureuses, Vous Serez Heureuses (Love and You will be Happy), from the Suite of Late Woodblock Prints (also known as the Vollard Suite)

makers.displaydate: 1848–1903; born Paris, France; died Atuona, Marquesas Islands
makers.displaymaker: Paul Gauguin, 1848–1903; born Paris, France; died Atuona, Marquesas Islands

texts.textentryhtml: Consigned by the artist, Tahiti, to his friend, the artist Georges-Daniel de Monfreid (1856–1929), Paris, after Jan. 1900; ?; Paul Prouté S.A., Paris; August Laube, Zurich; sold at auction, Sotheby’s, London, Old Master, Modern and Contemporary Prints, March 30, 2011, lot 76 (estimate 15,000-20,000 GBP; sold for 73,250 GPB/$117,500 premium); private collector, USA.

displaymaker: Paul Gauguin, 1848–1903; born Paris, France; died Atuona, Marquesas Islands
caption: Paul Gauguin (1848–1903; born Paris, France; died Atuona, Marquesas Islands), Soyez Amoureuses, Vous Serez Heureuses (Love and You will be Happy), from the Suite of Late Woodblock Prints (also known as the Vollard Suite), 1899. Woodblock print in black, brown, and gray inks on two sheets of thin Japanese wove paper; 16.7 × 27.7 cm. Museum purchase, Fowler McCormick, Class of 1921, Fund (2022-220)

Woodblock print in black, brown, and gray inks on two sheets of thin Japanese wove paper; 16.7 × 27.7 cm. Museum purchase, Fowler McCormick, Class of 1921, Fund (2022-220)
